data.answer:
import pandas as pd 
 # Create a DataFrame 
 data = {'Name': ['John', 'Jane', 'Jack', 'Jill'], 
 	 'Age': [23, 25, 21, 18], 
 	 'Gender': ['M', 'F', 'M', 'F']} 
 df = pd.DataFrame(data) 
 # print DataFrame 
 print(df)

data.question: select specific columns of a dataframe

data.answer:
import pandas as pd 
 # Create a dataframe with names and ages 
  df = pd.DataFrame({'Name': ['Alice', 'Bob', 'Charlie', 'Debbie'], 
 	 'Age': [25, 30, 35, 40]}) 
 # Print the age of the person at row 2 
 print(df.at[2, 'Age'])
data.question: print a specific positon of a dataframe

data.answer:
import pandas as pd 
 
 # Create a dataframe with names and ages 
 df = pd.DataFrame({'Name': ['Alice', 'Bob', 'Charlie', 'Debbie'],
 	 'Age': [25, 30, 35, 40]}) 
 # Set the index to be the 'Name' column 
 df.set_index('Name', inplace=True) 
 
 # Print the age of the person with name 'Charlie' 
 print(df.at['Charlie', 'Age'])
data.question: print a specific positon of a dataframe clearly
